comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: According to a December, 1908 New York Times article, the seasonal Christmas tree market was on West Street, between Spring and Fulton Streets, with the tree merchants being granted the right to use some of the broad areas in front of the Hudson River piers there. This picture was taken on West Street across from Pier 21, which, according to this map www.bklyn-genealogy-info.com/Map/Man.1911.html was near Duane St. and West. The area west of the docks has since been filled in and the docks removed. query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F70613F83C5517...

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thanks artolog. We will add more location information to the description of this interesting image when we update.
